DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Donor Cell Blood Assessment Percentage Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100 related to the presence of the smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid, from someone who gives blood (the liquid tissue with the major function to transport oxygen throughout the body, supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection) to be used in another person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Donor Cell Blood Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the presence of the smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid, from someone who gives blood (the liquid tissue with the major function to transport oxygen throughout the body, supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection) to be used in another person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: Someone who gives blood or tissue or an organ to be used in another person.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to COG for by script Thu Jan 2 10:00:57 EST 2014

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the value as a percentage of 100.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
